intro: Ribes guangxiense, commonly known as Guangxi gooseberry, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae, which includes other shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit, a red, fleshy berry, is edible and often consumed fresh or used in local cuisines. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forested areas.
